title: 108_hr4135
content: The Act titled "Taxation of Minor Children Simplification Act of 2004" addresses the taxation of minor children. The Taxation of Minor Children Simplification Act of 2004 amends the application of the Trust Rate Schedule to the net unearned income of minor children under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It modifies subsection (g) of section 1 by reorganizing paragraphs and specifying the tax calculation for children subject to this subsection. The Taxation of Minor Children Simplification Act of 2004 amends the tax calculation for children under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It expands the parental election to claim a child's income on the parent's return. The Taxation of Minor Children Simplification Act of 2004 allows parents to include their child's income on their tax return without the child needing to file a separate return or claim deductions. The Taxation of Minor Children Simplification Act of 2004 allows parents to include their child's income on their tax return, with deductions limited to the child's gross income. Estimated tax payments and interest can be attributed to the child or parent for tax purposes. The Taxation of Minor Children Simplification Act of 2004 allows parents to include their child's income on their tax return. The parent with the greater taxable income can make an election under section 57(a)(5) for tax preference treatment. The Taxation of Minor Children Simplification Act of 2004 allows parents to include their child's income on their tax return. The parent with greater taxable income can elect for tax preference treatment, with carryovers allowed and regulations prescribed by the Secretary. A conforming amendment is made to the heading of subsection (g) of section 1 of the Code, and the effective date for these amendments is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2004.
